intro: Paullinia hystrix, commonly known as the spiked piper, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by round, woody fruits containing several seeds. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a rough, leathery texture. Paullinia hystrix is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
